3. Tumor formation: This is a broad term that refers to the uncontrolled growth of cells and the development of a mass of tissue. It is not a specific disease, but rather a common outcome of various underlying genetic and environmental factors. In this context, it is likely that the cellular defect in serum-dependent growth control caused by the loss of the VHL gene may contribute to tumor formation.
